occupation: Rector at Graz University of Technology
headline: Rector at Graz University of Technology
summary:
Horst Bischof received his M.S. and Ph.D. degree in computer science from the Vienna University of Technology in 1990 and 1993. In 1998 he got his Habilitation (venia docendi) for applied computer science. Currently he is Vice Rector for Research at Graz University of Technology and Professor at the Institute for Computer Graphics and Vision at the Graz University of Technology, Austria. H. Bischof is a member of the scientific board of Joanneum Research.  His research interests include object recognition, visual learning, on-line and life-long learning, motion and tracking, visual surveillance and biometrics and medical computer vision where he has published more than 750 peer reviewed scientific papers.

Horst Bischof was General Chair of CVPR 2015 and ECCV2018. He was program co-chair of ECCV2006 and ECCV 2020. He is multiple times Area chair of all major vision conferences. He was Associate Editor for IEEE Trans. on Pattern Analysis and Machine Intelligence, Pattern Recognition, Computer and Informatics and the Journal of Universal Computer Science.

Horst Bischof is member of the European academy of sciences and has received several awards  >20 among them the Most Influential Paper over the Decade Award from MVA 2019, the Jan Konderink award at ECCV 2018 and the 29th Pattern Recognition award in 2002, the main price of the German Association for Pattern Recognition DAGM in 2007 and 2012, the Best scientific paper award at the BMCV 2007, the BMVC best demo award 2012 and the Best scientific paper awards at the ICPR 2008, ICPR2010, PCV 2010, AAPR2010 and ACCV 2012.

positions.title: Doctoral Researcher
positions.description:
Development of translational 3D in vitro models for breast cancer research.

The tissue microenvironment is crucial for many pathological processes such as breast cancer. My project aims to develop a tissue-specific 3D cancer model mimicking the mammary tissue environment, which is important in cancer cell behaviour and drug response. Overcoming limitations of conventional 2D cell culture techniques, our approach using a semi-synthetic biomaterial to reconstruct the matrix in our 3D cultures reflect closer cell-cell and cell-matrix interactions involved in breast cancer in situ.

headline: Founder, Chief Executive Officer & Chief Scientific Officer at eQcell Inc.
summary:
Dr. Koch is a Full Professor in the Department of Biomedical Sciences, Ontario Veterinary College, University of Guelph, Canada. He received his Veterinary degree from the Royal Veterinary and Agricultural University, Copenhagen, Denmark. Dr. Koch‚Äôs current research focus is on stem cell and tissue engineering-based therapies with joint cartilage repair being the main area of investigation. Studies on equine and canine stem cells, joint cartilage and synovial joint health are pursued in parallel. Within this applied research approach basic mechanistic insights of joint homeostasis and the chondrogenic cell fate is sought including studies in the area of cell mechanobiology. Emerging research areas of interest include tendon and ligament repair and the regulatory roles of microRNA. Novel therapies applied in horses and dogs with natural spontaneous disease serve as important translational pre-clinical animal models of similar human diseases.

His work has resulted in one spin-off company, eQcell Inc, which is developing stem cell services for horses and dogs. He serves as Chief Executive Officer and Chief Scientific Officer.

Supplemental to his research program he participates as a senior clinician in the out-of-hours emergency service at the Veterinary Teaching Hospital at the Ontario Veterinary College for the  Large Animal Internal Medicine Section.

headline: Professor of Finance | Chairman, Executive Education | Keynote speaker
summary: Alexander Wagner balances two passions: the thrill of seeking knowledge about fundamentals of human behavior for knowledge's sake, and the desire to apply insights in the real world and to improve the workings of markets and organizations. As a professor at the Department of Finance of the University of Zurich (UZH) and as a Senior Chair of the Swiss Finance Institute (SFI), Wagner has taught corporate finance to thousands of eager students and hundreds of motivated executives, and he has helped shape governance systems of companies large and small. He is the Chairman of the Executive Education of the UZH Faculty of Business, Economics, and Informatics, and he is Co-Head of the UZH Center for Crisis Competence. He has served as chairman of a proxy advisor and as an independent counsel for PwC. His research focuses on corporate finance, sustainable finance, and behavioral economics. He obtained his PhD in Political Economy from Harvard University. In his hometown Linz, Austria, he completed studies in economics and law.

headline: Professor of Robotics and Perception at the University of Zurich
summary: Davide Scaramuzza is a Professor of Robotics and Perception at the University of Zurich. He did his Ph.D. at ETH Zurich, a postdoc at the University of Pennsylvania, and was a visiting professor at Stanford University. His research focuses on autonomous, agile navigation of mini drones using standard and event-based cameras. He pioneered autonomous, vision-based navigation of drones, which inspired the navigation algorithm of the NASA Mars helicopter and many drone companies. In 2022, his team demonstrated that an AI-powered drone could outperform the world champion of drone racing, a result published in Nature. He has been consulting the United Nations on disaster response, the Fukushima Action Plan, disarmament, and AI for good. For his research contributions, he has won many awards, including the very recent IEEE Kiyo Tomiyasu Technical Field Award, the IEEE Robotics and Automation Society Early Career Award, a European Research Council Consolidator Grant, and many paper awards, including the IROS 2023 Best Paper Award, the IEEE Robotics and Automation Letters' and Transactions on Robotics best paper awards, and a 2023 CVPR Best Paper Award finalist. Davide contributed significantly to visual-inertial state estimation, vision-based agile navigation of microdrones, and low-latency, robust perception with event cameras. His results have been transferred to many products, from drones to automobiles, cameras, AR/VR headsets, and mobile devices. Davide counts several entrepreneurial achievements: in 2015, he co-founded Zurich-Eye, which became Meta Zurich, which developed the world-leading virtual-reality headset Meta Quest. In 2020, he co-founded SUIND, which builds autonomous drones for precision agriculture. Many aspects of his research have been featured in the media, such as The New York Times, The Economist, and Forbes.

occupation: Director of the Swiss National Cybersecurity Center

positions.title: Director National Cybersecurity Center
positions.description:
Strengthens cyber security in critical infrastructures, the economy, the education system, the population and in government, by leading the development and implementation of the National Cyber Strategy (NCS). 

Making cyber threats understandable by breaking down the complexity of cyber threats into tangible risks and possible mitigations for various audiences, in order to facilitate dialogue between government, business and society on cyber security. Thus, enabling partner organizations and clients alike to take active responsibility in reducing systemic risks.

Provides the means to prevent cyberattacks by reducing the attack surface presented by Swiss individuals and organizations in cyberspace. Drives the implementation of a national, digital platform to proactively warn organizations of threats, incidents and breaches, and provides them with the requisite intelligence and tooling to help prevent incidents.

Reduces the damage from cyber incidents by operating the GovCERT that helps victims to mitigate / deal with cyber attacks. Collects and disseminates threat intelligence to minimize the risk of incidents propagating.

Increases the security of digital products and services by promoting business models, which incentivize manufacturers to offer products and services that are both secure and affordable. Promotes transparency for users so that they can make informed decisions about the cyber security of products and services.

Heading interdepartmental committees on cyber risks and working closely with the cantons and the business community.

In the role of Federal Cyber Security Delegate established the new Swiss National Cyber and created the structures for its implementation.

occupation: Rector at Graz University of Technology
headline: Rector at Graz University of Technology
summary:
Horst Bischof received his M.S. and Ph.D. degree in computer science from the Vienna University of Technology in 1990 and 1993. In 1998 he got his Habilitation (venia docendi) for applied computer science. Currently he is Vice Rector for Research at Graz University of Technology and Professor at the Institute for Computer Graphics and Vision at the Graz University of Technology, Austria. H. Bischof is a member of the scientific board of Joanneum Research.  His research interests include object recognition, visual learning, on-line and life-long learning, motion and tracking, visual surveillance and biometrics and medical computer vision where he has published more than 750 peer reviewed scientific papers.

Horst Bischof was General Chair of CVPR 2015 and ECCV2018. He was program co-chair of ECCV2006 and ECCV 2020. He is multiple times Area chair of all major vision conferences. He was Associate Editor for IEEE Trans. on Pattern Analysis and Machine Intelligence, Pattern Recognition, Computer and Informatics and the Journal of Universal Computer Science.

Horst Bischof is member of the European academy of sciences and has received several awards  >20 among them the Most Influential Paper over the Decade Award from MVA 2019, the Jan Konderink award at ECCV 2018 and the 29th Pattern Recognition award in 2002, the main price of the German Association for Pattern Recognition DAGM in 2007 and 2012, the Best scientific paper award at the BMCV 2007, the BMVC best demo award 2012 and the Best scientific paper awards at the ICPR 2008, ICPR2010, PCV 2010, AAPR2010 and ACCV 2012.

positions.title: Doctoral Researcher
positions.description:
Development of translational 3D in vitro models for breast cancer research.

The tissue microenvironment is crucial for many pathological processes such as breast cancer. My project aims to develop a tissue-specific 3D cancer model mimicking the mammary tissue environment, which is important in cancer cell behaviour and drug response. Overcoming limitations of conventional 2D cell culture techniques, our approach using a semi-synthetic biomaterial to reconstruct the matrix in our 3D cultures reflect closer cell-cell and cell-matrix interactions involved in breast cancer in situ.

headline: Founder, Chief Executive Officer & Chief Scientific Officer at eQcell Inc.
summary:
Dr. Koch is a Full Professor in the Department of Biomedical Sciences, Ontario Veterinary College, University of Guelph, Canada. He received his Veterinary degree from the Royal Veterinary and Agricultural University, Copenhagen, Denmark. Dr. Koch‚Äôs current research focus is on stem cell and tissue engineering-based therapies with joint cartilage repair being the main area of investigation. Studies on equine and canine stem cells, joint cartilage and synovial joint health are pursued in parallel. Within this applied research approach basic mechanistic insights of joint homeostasis and the chondrogenic cell fate is sought including studies in the area of cell mechanobiology. Emerging research areas of interest include tendon and ligament repair and the regulatory roles of microRNA. Novel therapies applied in horses and dogs with natural spontaneous disease serve as important translational pre-clinical animal models of similar human diseases.

His work has resulted in one spin-off company, eQcell Inc, which is developing stem cell services for horses and dogs. He serves as Chief Executive Officer and Chief Scientific Officer.

Supplemental to his research program he participates as a senior clinician in the out-of-hours emergency service at the Veterinary Teaching Hospital at the Ontario Veterinary College for the  Large Animal Internal Medicine Section.

headline: Professor of Finance | Chairman, Executive Education | Keynote speaker
summary: Alexander Wagner balances two passions: the thrill of seeking knowledge about fundamentals of human behavior for knowledge's sake, and the desire to apply insights in the real world and to improve the workings of markets and organizations. As a professor at the Department of Finance of the University of Zurich (UZH) and as a Senior Chair of the Swiss Finance Institute (SFI), Wagner has taught corporate finance to thousands of eager students and hundreds of motivated executives, and he has helped shape governance systems of companies large and small. He is the Chairman of the Executive Education of the UZH Faculty of Business, Economics, and Informatics, and he is Co-Head of the UZH Center for Crisis Competence. He has served as chairman of a proxy advisor and as an independent counsel for PwC. His research focuses on corporate finance, sustainable finance, and behavioral economics. He obtained his PhD in Political Economy from Harvard University. In his hometown Linz, Austria, he completed studies in economics and law.

headline: Professor of Robotics and Perception at the University of Zurich
summary: Davide Scaramuzza is a Professor of Robotics and Perception at the University of Zurich. He did his Ph.D. at ETH Zurich, a postdoc at the University of Pennsylvania, and was a visiting professor at Stanford University. His research focuses on autonomous, agile navigation of mini drones using standard and event-based cameras. He pioneered autonomous, vision-based navigation of drones, which inspired the navigation algorithm of the NASA Mars helicopter and many drone companies. In 2022, his team demonstrated that an AI-powered drone could outperform the world champion of drone racing, a result published in Nature. He has been consulting the United Nations on disaster response, the Fukushima Action Plan, disarmament, and AI for good. For his research contributions, he has won many awards, including the very recent IEEE Kiyo Tomiyasu Technical Field Award, the IEEE Robotics and Automation Society Early Career Award, a European Research Council Consolidator Grant, and many paper awards, including the IROS 2023 Best Paper Award, the IEEE Robotics and Automation Letters' and Transactions on Robotics best paper awards, and a 2023 CVPR Best Paper Award finalist. Davide contributed significantly to visual-inertial state estimation, vision-based agile navigation of microdrones, and low-latency, robust perception with event cameras. His results have been transferred to many products, from drones to automobiles, cameras, AR/VR headsets, and mobile devices. Davide counts several entrepreneurial achievements: in 2015, he co-founded Zurich-Eye, which became Meta Zurich, which developed the world-leading virtual-reality headset Meta Quest. In 2020, he co-founded SUIND, which builds autonomous drones for precision agriculture. Many aspects of his research have been featured in the media, such as The New York Times, The Economist, and Forbes.

headline: CEO & Co-founder at Bcomp
summary:
Christian, CEO at Bcomp Ltd, PhD in material sciences and mountain lover, left corporate and co-founded Bcomp to challenge the traditional lightweight material industry. Today, Bcomp is an award-winning, leading supplier of sustainable lightweight solutions and part of the ongoing revolution towards cleaner mobility. Provides the means to prevent cyberattacks by reducing the attack surface presented by Swiss individuals and organizations in cyberspace. Reduces the damage from cyber incidents by operating the GovCERT that helps victims to mitigate / deal with cyber attacks. Collects and disseminates threat intelligence to minimize the risk of incidents propagating.

Increases the security of digital products and services by promoting business models, which incentivize manufacturers to offer products and services that are both secure and affordable. Promotes transparency for users so that they can make informed decisions about the cyber security of products and services.

headline: Director, AI Initiative, KAUST; Scientific Director, Swiss AI Lab, IDSIA; Adj. Prof. of AI, Univ. Lugano; Co-Founder & Chief Scientist, NNAISENSE
summary: The New York Times headlined: "When A.I. Matures, It May Call J√ºrgen Schmidhuber 'Dad'." Since age 15, his main goal has been to build a self-improving A.I. smarter than himself, then retire. His lab's deep learning artificial neural networks based on ideas published in the "Annus Mirabilis" 1990-1991 have revolutionised machine learning and A.I. By 2017, they were on over 3 billion smartphones, and used billions of times per day, for Facebook‚Äôs automatic translation, Google‚Äôs speech recognition, Google Translate, Apple‚Äôs Siri & QuickType, Amazon‚Äôs Alexa, etc. Generative AI is also based on his work: he introduced artificial curiosity & generative adversarial networks (1990, now widely used), self-supervised pre-training for deep learning (1991, the "P" in "ChatGPT" stands for "pre-trained"), unnormalised linear Transformers (1991, the "T" in "ChatGPT" stands for "Transformer"), and meta-learning machines that learn to learn (since 1987, now widely used). His lab also produced LSTM, the most cited AI of the 20th century, and the LSTM-inspired Highway Net, the first very deep feedforward net with hundreds of layers (ResNet, the most cited AI of the 21st century, is an open-gated Highway Net). In 2006-2010, he published the "formal theory of fun and creativity." Elon Musk tweeted: "Schmidhuber invented everything." He is recipient of numerous awards, Co-Chair of the KAUST Gen AI Center in KSA, Scientific Director of the Swiss AI Lab IDSIA, and co-founder & former President of NNAISENSE. He is a frequent keynote speaker at major events, and advising various governments on A.I. strategies. More: https://people.idsia.ch/~juergen/blog.html

headline: Founder & Director Pflege PBS, Professor in Nursing Diagnostics & former ACENDIO President
summary:
Maria M√ºller-Staub was Professor Adjunct in Nursing Diagnostics at Hanze University, Nursing Department, in Groningen (NL). Formerly, she was Full Professor  in Acute Care at the Institute for Nursing Science, ZHAW University, Winterthur and Program Director of nursing research and research transfer courses.
She is an excellent nurse educator at graduate levels in nursing and supervisor of doctoral students. As an expert in curriculum development, she was Dean of a nursing school offering advanced nursing programs. 

Maria M√ºller-Staub is Founder & Director of Pflege PBS (Nurse Consulting, Teaching, & Research), Wil, Switzerland (CH). She implements nursing language related to the classifications of nursing diagnoses, interventions and outcomes (NANDA-I, NIC & NOC) in Swiss and German hospitals and nursing education programs. 

Her main focus in research and education is evidence-based practice based on nursing diagnostics, clinical decision making and critical thinking. She leads research and practice projects on standards for nursing documentation, nursing care quality and Clinical Information Systems (CIS). 

The instrument Quality of Diagnoses, Interventions and Outcomes (Q-DIO) was developed and tested to measure the quality of the nursing process as an audit tool. The Q-DIO was translated and tested in the languages German, English, Brazilian, Portugese, Italian, Spanish, Chinese, Slovenian, French and Bahasa Indonesian. 

Maria M√ºller-Staub has 356 publications and presented more than 200 oral papers. She was a lecturer in national and international nursing programs.

See further CV information and list of publications at:

headline: CEO at Speratum Biopharma
summary:
I previously worked as a Post-Doctoral Associate in the Department of Surgery at Baylor College of Medicine (BCM), in the laboratories of Dr. Qizhi Yao and Dr. Changyi Chen, with a focus on developing RNAi-based therapeutics for the treatment of cancer. 

That work is the basis for Speratum, a pre-clinical stage cancer therapy company with exclusive licenses for multiple technologies originally developed at BCM.  At Speratum we combine RNA interference (RNAi) and synthetic biology with a novel, polymeric nanoparticle-based delivery system. Our main focus is  on the treatment of pancreatic and ovarian cancers. We are currently developing novel targeted antiviral applications of our technology. 

I have been executive director of Speratum since its foundation in 2014. I have Ph.D. in Molecular Virology and Microbiology from BCM, an MS in Entrepreneurial Biotechnology from the Science and Technology Entrepreneurship Program (STEP) at Case, and a BS in molecular biology from Florida Tech. 

I have previously worked as a consultant to biotechnology start-up companies and governmental organizations. My work has contributed to the development of projects ranging from medical devices to HIV research. 

I am a founding member of the Scientific Ethics Committee for the Ministry of Health of Costa Rica, founding member of CRBiomed, the biomedical cluster of Costa Rica, and am a member of the Aspen Global Leadership Network (AGLN), the Aspen Institute, and the Central American Leadership Initiative (CALI).

headline: Evolutionary Neuroscience of Language
summary: Martin Meyer and his group are interested in all aspects of the relationship between brain and language. We ask how (spoken) language is used to understand the brain, and how the brain is used to understand (spoken) language. Using the full arsenal of modern neuroimaging approaches, we have investigated how right and left hemispheres contribute to decoding and understanding spoken utterances. In particular, we are interested in the influences of different forms of hearing loss and brain atrophy on the neuroplasticity of speech comprehension in different languages. Currently, we are working on a model of the evolutionary properties and origins of prosody and speech rhythm and their links to neural circuits of the motor system and aim to fathom the neural underpinning of structure planning during language production. Another area of our research examines the basis and treatment options for central hearing disorders, particularly chronic subjective tinnitus and its limiting effect on speech understanding and everyday communication.

headline: Bavarian State Ministry of Justice üîπ legal tech | AI
summary:
After studying law, I worked as a research assistant at the Chair of Public Law, Security Law and Internet Law of Professor Dr. Dirk Heckmann at the University of Passau from 2016 to 2018.

My dissertation was published in 2019 under the title "Digitalisation, Legal Technology and Innovation - The decisive legal framework and the requirements for a lawyer in the information technology society" by Duncker & Humblot (ISBN 978-3-428-15784-6). I have also published numerous articles on IT, copyright, media and data protection law and given numerous lectures. I am also co-editor of the journal "Recht digital (RDi)" published by C.H. Beck. 

From 2016 to 2022, I supported the IT, IP and Media Law Practice Group of HEUSSEN Rechtsanwaltsgesellschaft in Munich as a research assistant. There, I was also a member of the "Digitization & Legal Tech" team as a Digital Business Development Analyst since October 2019.

Since the winter semester 2020/2021 I have been teaching the Master's program Legal Tech (LL.M.) at the University of Regensburg. I have also been a lecturer at LMU in Munich since the summer semester of 2024.

Following my heart, I have been in the service of justice since May 2022, currently seconded to the Bavarian State Ministry of Justice. There, I contribute my expertise in the area of legal tech and AI.

headline: Director of the TUM Institute for Ethics in Artificial Intelligence bei Technische Universit√§t M√ºnchen
summary:
Christoph L√ºtge studied business informatics and philosophy in Braunschweig, Paris, G√∂ttingen and Berlin. He was a visiting scholar at the University of Pittsburgh (1997) and research fellow at the University of California, San Diego (1998). After taking his PhD in philosophy in 1999, L√ºtge held a position as assistant professor at the Chair for Philosophy and Economics of the University of Munich (LMU) from 1999 to 2007, where he also took his habilitation in 2005. He was acting professor at Witten/Herdecke University (2007-2008) and at Braunschweig University of Technology (2008-2010). Since 2010, he holds the Peter L√∂scher Chair in Business Ethics at the Technical University of Munich. In 2019, L√ºtge was appointed director of the new TUM Institute for Ethics in Artificial Intelligence. He has held visiting positions in Venice (2003), Kyoto (2015), Taipei (2015), at Harvard (2019) and the University of Stockholm (2020). In 2020, he was appointed Distinguished Visiting Professor of the University of Tokyo. His main areas of interest are ethics of AI, ethics of digitization, business ethics, foundations of ethics as well as philosophy of the social sciences and economics. His major publications include "Business Ethics: An Economically Informed Perspective" (Oxford University Press, 2021, with Matthias Uhl), "An Introduction to Ethics in Robotics and AI‚Äú (Springer, 2021, with coauthors) and "The Ethics of Competition‚Äù (Elgar, 2019; Japanese edition with Keio University Press, 2020).
He has been a member of the Ethics Commission on Automated and Connected Driving of the German Federal Ministry of Transport and Digital Infrastructure (2016-17), as well as of the European AI Ethics initiative AI4People (2018-). He has also done consulting work for the Singapore Economic Development Board and the Canadian Transport Commission.

headline: Director Data & AI (Chief Data Officer) @ FIEGE Logistik | 40over40 - Germany¬¥s most inspiring women 2022 | Ossi | Speaker | Author | Angel Investor | Bitkom Board Data Strategy
summary:
Claudia Pohlink has over 20 years of professional experience in the fields of data science, artificial intelligence and innovation management. As Director Data & AI at FIEGE Logistik, she is centrally responsible for data and AI topics.
Until summer 2024, she headed the Data Intelligence Center at Deutsche Bahn and was responsible for the group's data and AI strategy, including topics such as data governance, data management, data architectures, data mesh and data catalog. Prior to that, she headed the machine learning team at T-Labs, Deutsche Telekom's research unit. As co-founder of #startupnight, #DigitalWanderlust and #AI4DiversityHackathon, she strengthened the transfer of science into business. Her previous stations include MTV Networks and Jamba/Rocket Internet.
Claudia Pohlink is also active as a speaker and author. She is committed to the education of children and young people in the field of data and AI and regularly shares her knowledge at conferences and in schools and universities. Since 2020, she has been an active board member in the AI and Data working groups at BITKOM. In 2019, Claudia was recognized as a ‚ÄúGlobal Women Leader in AI,‚Äù recently as a ‚Äú40 over 40 - Germany's Most Inspiring Women 2022‚Äù and as one of ‚Äú30 Outstanding Women in Data - 2023 Global Recognition.‚Äù

summary:
2009 - Martin is department head at Fraunhofer IESE. 
He is heading the Embedded Systems Engineering department. 
Core competencies of the department include: 
- Model-based Systems Engineering, esp. RE and System Architecting/Design.
- Variation Management =  Variant & LifeCycle Management 

His specialties: 
‚Ä¢ Software and Systems Product Line Engineering, esp. architectures and implementation
‚Ä¢ CPS-Architectures with focus on self-adaptivity, runtime adaptation and context-awareness
‚Ä¢ Model-Based Systems Engineering

More on his C.V.:
Martin received his diploma in Computer Science and Electrical Engineering in 1997 from the University of Kaiserslautern. Between 1998 and 2003, he worked in a special research project on large system development with generic methods (SFB 501), where he developed several approaches for architecting and managing software product families.

In 2004, he received his Ph.D. (Dr. Ing.) in Computer Science in the field of variability management from the University of Kaiserslautern and got affiliated with the Product Line Architecture department of the Fraunhofer Institute for Empirical Software Engineering (IESE) in Kaiserslautern.  As a project manager, he conducted several applied research and technology transfer projects in the area of software product lines, component-based development, configuration support, and adaptive systems. From 2006-2009 he has coordiniated Fraunhofer IESE‚Äôs competence center on Ambient Intelligence (AMI) and Ambient Assisted Living (AAL). His special interest in AMI/AAL were reference architectures with focus on interoperability, adaptability and trustworthiness and context management.

Analysis included natural language processing, clustering analysis and decision trees algorithms.

Senior Consultant @ Audi AG | Change Consulting, Dr. phil
Founder & Partner Gesellschaft f√ºr empirische Organisationsforschung GfeO GmbH (Spin-off University of Regensburg)
summary:
As a Senior Consultant at Audi AG, I have been supporting the company for over 19 years in navigating complex and dynamic changes in the automotive industry. With my Ph.D. in Sociology and my expertise in change management and organizational development, I enable the company to balance exploration and exploitation, and to foster a culture of learning and renewal.

I am also a Senior Partner at GfeO mbH, a spin-off company from the University of Regensburg, where I provide change consulting services to various clients across different sectors and regions. I leverage my academic background and credentials in sociology, psychology, and economics to design and implement effective and sustainable solutions that address the challenges and opportunities of the digital transformation. Additionally, I am a lecturer at several prestigious universities and a member of the editorial board of a journal on applied organizational psychology. I am passionate about sharing my knowledge and insights on change communication, organization theory, and high-performance teams with the next generation of leaders and practitioners.

headline: PwC | Artificial Intelligence Partner | Transformation ‚Äì Technology ‚Äì Trust | Startup Investor and Advisor
summary:
Ver√§nderungen sind nicht immer leicht, aber in unserem Digitalzeitalter n√∂tig, um zu bestehen und zu wachsen. Ich unterst√ºtze Unternehmen bei ihren Transformationsprozessen, helfe ihnen, Probleme und Herausforderungen zu erkennen und langfristige L√∂sungen zu implementieren. 

Bei PwC bin ich als Partner spezialisiert auf #AI und unterst√ºtze Kunden, die Technologie verantwortungsvoll einsetzen zu k√∂nnen. Change ist mein Antrieb. Um K√ºnstliche Intelligenz erfolgreich im Betrieb zu operationalisieren, braucht es neben der Transformation und Technologie auch Vertrauen als essentielle Zutat. Meine tiefe √úberzeugung ist, dass Trust Kern erfolgreicher Gesch√§ftsmodelle ist. 
In √ºber zwanzig Jahren Berufserfahrung habe auch ich einige Ver√§nderungen durchlaufen - von Cyber, √ºber Cloud zu AI und vom (Co-)Gr√ºnder √ºber verschiedene Consulting Stationen zu PwC. 

Diesen Erfahrungsschatz nutze ich, um meine Kunden strategisch und mit Weitblick durch ihre individuelle Transformation zu navigieren. Um die besten L√∂sungen f√ºr unsere Kund*innen und die Gesellschaft zu finden, bewegen wir uns immer vor der Welle - mit dem Ziel, erfolgreiche L√∂sungen f√ºr eine neue digitale Zukunft zu gestalten.

headline: Artificial Intelligence | Innovation | Ecosystems
summary:
There are three major themes in my career: Innovation, Digital Technologies and Ecosystems. 
I am fascinated by the innovative possibilities of digital technologies, and how they can be implemented quickly and successfully through Ecosystems. 

For the past 10 plus years, I‚Äôve been particularly involved with the topic of Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning , how it gives rise to innovative solutions and the strategic importance of collaboration, strategic partnerships and ecosystems .

Current activities
With the AI.FUND (https://ai-fund.vc/) we invest in European AI startups.
I am the Managing Director of KI-Allianz Baden-W√ºrttemberg eG (https://ki-allianz.de/), which aims to establish a centre and ecosystem for AI in the state that is competitive and visible throughout Europe and internationally.
With ADI Innovation (https://www.adi.de/) and IBHO Management (https://ibho.de/) , I advise enterprises, startups and the public sector on the implementation of digital transformation and applications of AI.

In 2020 I have been nominated by the German government as an Member of the Global Partnership on AI (https://gpai.ai/), where I advance the topics of innovation & commercialization of AI with experts from 20 countries.
Since 2020 I support the German Federal Agency for disruptive Innovations (https://www.sprind.org/en/) as an expert for AI
Since 2018 I support the German Government in the development of the German AI Strategy.

Past activities:

Through AI.Hamburg I promoted the transfer and use of AI in companies in Hamburg and Northern Germany. Together with other AI initiatives, we founded AI4Germany to foster collaboration and bring Germany into the AI age.
At appliedAI / UnternehmerTUM, I expanded the AI Ecosystem in Germany and Europe.
I supported the T√ºbingen AI Competence Center and the Cyber Valley Initiative as General Manager with a focus on the transfer of AI from science into business.
At IBM, I helped to roll out the topic of AI and Watson Health in Europe.
For almost 20 years, I held various management positions at SAP. I introduced new technologies to the market (ERP R/3), built up the global partnership with Microsoft, helped initiate the global technology partner program, was responsible for the product portfolio in the public sector and built up strategic risk management (today Foresight) for the Executive Board.
